num_items_impact_text: Some things needed to be typed, but there were a lot of choices making it easy to communicate
expression_text: The ease of usage enhanced my ability
request_rationale: Anything that wasn't listed, could be typed so I could ask for anything I want
best_text: How easy it is to use
worst_text: The automated voice, could be humanized a little bit

num_items_impact_text: The number of items on the screen only affected my ability to communicate because I thought the questions that were asked were going to pertain to items on the screen. However, I actually had to type most of my words out.
expression_text: My preconceptions of the app. I thought I was going to be able to use the apps items on the screen fully to answer my questions, but had to use the key board.
request_rationale: I would be able to use this tool to make a request because of the key board, and other items on the app.
consverse_rationale: I would be able to use this tool to have a conversation because there are icons I can use for specific conversations and there is a key board for things I want to say that are not items on the app.
best_text: The best thing about using the app to communicate is that the app has a key board for words that are not on the screen. Furthermore, I enjoyed just being able to click anywhere in the white space for the text box to reply fully.
worst_text: The worst thing about using the app is that I had to type out most of what I wanted to respond when asked questions.

num_items_impact_text: There were not enough options toward school related tasks
expression_text: The fact that when I was typing it said the letter or sounded out the word before I was finished and that got me off task.
request_rationale: Because there was a help question and the key board.
consverse_rationale: Yes, but there is a lot of typing that is needed, so it makes the conversation take longer than it would with mostly pictures.
best_text: I think the folders was a really great idea to communicate, and the pictures made it easy to use and communicate.
worst_text: There was too much typing, I think it needs more pictures because some students don't know how to spell especially if the are in a moderate to intensive classroom.

num_items_impact_text: At times it felt like there were too many items on the screen and it was difficult to find things. At other times, I liked how things were condensed into folders and it was relatively easy to navigate.
expression_text: Having the keyboard really enhanced my ability to express my thoughts. While pictures are great, sometimes I just wanted to use the keyboard and type my entire answer because that would've been more efficient than trying to find all the pictures I wanted to.
request_rationale: Yes for the most part I could use this tool to ask for help, it gets challenging when you're asking for specific help. Like for a marker or eraser. I found every tool but either one of those.
consverse_rationale: I could have limited conversation, and it wouldn't flow well because of all the time it would take to find the words I wanted to say.
best_text: The best thing about using this app is being able to understand the thoughts of someone who has a difficult time speaking. A girls I worked with in high school used one and she could talk, but it was very difficult to understand her. However, when she used her tool which was similar, it was clear and I knew what she wanted.
worst_text: It was frustrating when I was looking for a word and couldn't find it. Like the word movie, or marker.

num_items_impact_text: Sometimes I was not sure where to look for a certain button. For example, I kept looking in the wrong spot for help. I also should have looked at all the button options before completing a sentence.
expression_text: The Keyboard option was nice and when I couldn't find a button, I used the keyboard. I was limited from not knowing where to look for certain words.
request_rationale: There are all the words needed to ask for help. For example: may, I, have, help
consverse_rationale: Some words needed for easy communication were not there that I saw. Words like: My, specific animals, and some others that may be necessary. Again if I would have looked at all of the buttons first, I probably would've found more words.
best_text: It is nice that you can use the buttons individually as well as being able to form a sentence.
worst_text: Not knowing the location of small connecting words or topic specific words.

num_items_impact_text: I was struggling trying to find the basic symbols and felt like I had to search different pages to find that specific one.
expression_text: When asked specific questions based on my opinion, I felt like there wasn't symbols that were offered. It was easier when answering generic questions.
request_rationale: I agree because once I remembered the items it was easier, but it was still difficult to find those unique last bits of information to complete that sentence to be able to be understood.
consverse_rationale: It took a long time for me to find these symbols to represent my words. The conversation would take a very long time. I was able to have a very basic conversation, just not in detail.
best_text: It is simple to use and very self explanitory, especially for little kids to use as well.
worst_text: It is generic and at times was frustrating to use because of the lack of words I was able to find in a decent time. I was able to type words out and would most likely use that over searching for symbols.
